v.v: You are righteous, Yahweh, whenever I bring disputes to you.
You planted them and they took root. They continue to produce fruit.
Yet you, Yahweh, know me. You see me and you test my heart toward you.
How long will the land go on drying up, and the plants in every field wither because of the wickedness of its inhabitants?
Yahweh said, “Indeed, if you, Jeremiah, have run with foot soldiers and they have tired you out, how can you compete against horses?
For even your brothers and your father’s family have betrayed you and have loudly denounced you.
I have abandoned my house; I have forsaken my inheritance.
My inheritance has become to me like a lion in a thicket;
Has not my prized possession become a speckled bird, that other birds of prey go against her all around?
Many shepherds have destroyed my vineyard. They have stomped all over my portion of land;
They have made her a desolation. I mourn for her; she is desolate.
Destroyers have come against all the bare places in the wilderness,
They have sown wheat but harvest thornbushes. They are exhausted from work but have gained nothing.

v: I must certainly tell you of my reason to complain: Why do the ways of the wicked succeed? All the faithless people are successful.
You are near to them in their mouths, but far away from their hearts.
Take them away like sheep to the slaughter, and set them apart for the day of slaughter!
The animals and the birds have been taken away. Indeed, the people say, “God will not see what happens to us.”
If you fall down in the safe countryside, how will you do in the thickets along the Jordan?
Do not trust in them, even if they say nice things to you.
I have given my beloved into the hands of her enemies.
she sets herself against me with her own voice, so I hate her.
Go and gather all the wild beasts and bring them to devour her.
they turned my delightful portion into a wilderness, a desolation.
All the land has been made desolate, for there is no one who takes it to heart.
for Yahweh’s sword is devouring from one end of the land to the other.
There is no safety in the land for any living creature.
So be ashamed of your gain because of Yahweh’s anger.”

v.v: Yahweh says this against all my neighbors, the wicked ones who strike at the possession that I made my people Israel inherit, “See, I am the one who is about to uproot them from their own ground, and I will pull up the house of Judah from among them.
Then after I uproot those nations, it will happen that I will have compassion on them and bring them back; I will return them—each man to his inheritance and his land.

It will come about that if those nations carefully learn the ways of my people, to swear by my name ‘As Yahweh lives’ just as they have taught my people to swear by Baal, then they will be built up in the midst of my people.
But if any do not listen, then I will uproot that nation. It will certainly be uprooted and destroyed—this is Yahweh’s declaration.”
